Subject: Ordered execution of test cases

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
From: Boris Boehlen <boris@...-aachen.de>

Hello,

I'd like to execute my test within a test cases in a predefined order 
because each test cases needs results created by the first one. It is 
also very important that each test is executed exactly once. An example 
for this is something like:

   1.) Create database
   2.) Create tables
   3.) Fill tables
   4.) Delete some tables
   5.) Check contents of tables

All these steps should be execute in a single test case in a definite 
order. At the moment I have my own "runTest" method defined in my test 
case which execute the methods "testCreateDatbase" and so on in the 
desired order. The signature of the test methods is like "public void 
testXXX()" the "runTest" methods is defined as "public void runTest()".

When I start the TestRunner provided by Ant first the method "runTest" 
is executed (which is OK). But then the other methods are executed in an
arbritrary order (I suppose). How can I change this behaviour?

BTW, I'd like to define a test suite in which different test cases are 
executed in a predefined order. How can I achieve this or is this the 
default behaviour in a test suite?

Regards
	Boris Boehlen

--
